paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the KCNH2 gene variant R176W, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: Proband asymptomatic except for occasional palpitations; sister diagnosed with LQTS, QTc 550 ms, sudden death.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Although there is a family history of overt LQTS, this individual was asymptomatic except for occasional palpitations.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQTS, QTc 550 ms, presence of palpitations, and sudden death.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: His sister was diagnosed with LQTS having a QT(U)c interval of 550 ms, presence of palpitations and sudden death at the age of 32.

functional_data.summary: The R176W mutation in KCNH2 leads to prolonged action potential duration and reduced IKr density in cardiomyocytes.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family; the sister was affected while the proband was unaffected.
variants.evidence_level: strong evidence based on family history and functional assays.
variants.additional_notes: The proband's QTc was 437 ms, indicating a relatively mild phenotype despite the pathogenic variant.
key_quotes: Although there is a family history of overt LQTS, this individual was asymptomatic except for occasional palpitations.
His sister was diagnosed with LQTS having a QT(U)c interval of 550 ms, presence of palpitations and sudden death at the age of 32.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
